page.title: 03Disused Railway
page.content: A G.W.R.branch line, Taunton-Barn- staple, stopping in Brushford, closed in 1966, the nearest station now being over 20 miles away. Somerset County Council bought the disused track for a greenway.Farmers and householders own some sections but from the church path to Nightcott remains a public footpath and bridleway with 4 access points. This is maintained by the County Council, and is a popular level walk for Brushford people. In the 1984 drought, South West Water Authority used the old track for an emergency pipeline for water from Wimbleball Lake, via R.Exe, to be pumped to join the R.Yeo, thence to supply N.Devon. This will be used for 10 years if needed. The bed of the pipeline was also used to bring mains water from N.Devon to some households in N.East of Brushford Parish.
